Content.Text:
<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Yo, <MYNAME>. Didja bring all the materials for
the renovation?

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
You did? Perfect! Let's head on up to your
place, then. I'll teach you how to renovate it.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Okay, let's get to work!
<PAGE>
Oh, but first you're gonna need a <BLUE>craft table</BLUE>.
Hang on a sec, I'll build you one, on the house.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Done.
<PAGE>
This here's a <BLUE>craft table</BLUE>. With this, some
blueprints and the right materials, you can start
building things yourself.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Before we get started, lemme give you some
<BLUE>blueprints</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
There. Those're for a house and a craft table.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Use the blueprints I just gave you and the
materials here to renovate your house. Here,
lemme tell you how to do it.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
All right, let's get this renovation underway! I'll
be right here helpin' ya, so give it your best shot.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Not bad. Not bad at all!

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
With the right blueprints and materials, you can
renovate your house or make all kinds of things
from scratch.
<PAGE>
I sell some blueprints at my shop, and I know
there are some you can get through the Trade
Depot. Keep your eyes open for 'em.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Here. Let me give you a book on how to read
blueprints. If you ever need a refresher, give it a
read.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You've got a bigger house now, so there's more
space to store things. Try making some of the
things you find blueprints for.
<PAGE>
And since you've got a closet now, you've got a
place to hang any clothes you might make.
<PAGE>
I'll give you a book on how that works, too. Give
it a read sometime.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Okay. I'm a man of my word -- I built you a barn
as a housewarming gift. C'mon over this way.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh! About your craft table...
<PAGE>
I put a <BLUE>Mini Craft Table</BLUE> by your bed. It can only
do Home Editing, but give it a try sometime.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Seems like we've covered just about everything
now, so I'm headin' home. Good luck with your
farm.

I put your <BLUE>blueprints</BLUE> at the right end of your
craft table.
<PAGE>
When you wanna make something, search that
stack of <BLUE>blueprints</BLUE> and select <BLUE>Build</BLUE>.

That'll open up the build screen.

This is the build screen.

Here's where you pick what you wanna make.
When you get a new blueprint, it'll automatically
be added to this list.

Look up on the right side of the top screen to
see what materials you'll need. If you have what
you need, you can select it.
<PAGE>
I'll come help you with big stuff like home
renovations, but you can handle most
everything else yourself.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Right then, that's about all there is to know
about blueprints. Now, lemme say a few words
about <BLUE>Editing</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
Editing refers to taking the stuff you build from a
blueprint and placing it somewhere.
<PAGE>
After all, no point in makin' something if you
aren't gonna put it to use. Anyway, it goes like
so...

See the model at the left end of the craft table?

When you wanna edit something, go over to the
model and view it with the <BLUE>A Button</BLUE>.
<PAGE>
Now, y'got two different kinds of editing; <BLUE>Farm
Editing</BLUE> and <BLUE>Home Editing</BLUE>.

You use Farm Edit to move things around out
on your farm and Home Edit to move things
around inside your house.
<PAGE>
This time, let's do a Farm Edit.

When you pick Farm Edit, the top screen
displays your farm.

Go stand in front of the object you want to
move and <BLUE>press A</BLUE> to pick it up.

That blue box in front of you will show you
where the object'll go when you set it down.

The size of that box also shows you how much
space that object's gonna take up.

On the other hand, if the object won't fit where
you're trying to put it, the box turns red.

Sometimes there'll be other stuff in the way,
and you can't put anything in that spot.
<PAGE>
When you want to put an object away, just pick
it up and <BLUE>press the Y Button</BLUE>.

If there's something new you wanna place,
<BLUE>press the X Button</BLUE> while you aren't holding
anything.
<PAGE>
That'll bring up the stock screen. Just select the
object you want and you'll pull it out and pick it
up.

You can turn the object you're holding 90
degrees by <BLUE>pressing the L Button or R Button</BLUE>,
so spin it to place it in the direction you want.
<PAGE>
To finish editing, <BLUE>press the Y Button</BLUE> when
you're not holding anything. You can stop
anytime you'd like.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
And that's about all I've got to say about editing.
<PAGE>
I'll give you a book on it, so give it a read if
you've got any more questions.
<PAGE>
Still, you'll learn more by doin' than you will just
readin' about it, so go ahead and try it for
yourself.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, dearie, are you here?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I just met with Gunther, and he was telling me
he'd built you a barn.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Now, do you remember this cow?
<PAGE>
That's right, it's Hanako! You took care of her for
a little while when I was teaching you how to
farm.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It looks like she really took a liking to you.
<PAGE>
She's looked kind of lonely ever since you left,
so if you wouldn't mind...
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Would you take her, as a present from me?

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Don't you worry about me, now. I'm sure Hanako
will be happy living with you.

<FACE_EDDA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Ah, that's wonderful to hear. Mr. Otmar sells
fodder at his shop, so be sure to get some for
her to eat.
<PAGE>
If you want to let your cows out, just stand
behind them and give 'em a firm push out the
door.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>I've put a book on your bookshelf about raising
cows. Be sure to read it if you need to brush up
on cow care.
<PAGE>
I'll take Hanako out to your barn, then.

I got Hanako the cow from Eda! I should take
good care of her.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Excuse me, are you in, <MYNAME>?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I heard from Gunther that you have a barn now.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Do you remember this cow?
<PAGE>
This is one of the cows that Madam Eda was
raising.

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
When Madam Eda was still well, she asked a
favor of me.
<PAGE>
She said she wanted you to have Hanako,
should she ever pass on.
<PAGE>
I have been keeping her myself, since you didn't
have a barn until now.
<PAGE>
But now that you do, will you accept Madam
Eda's wishes and take Hanako in?

<FACE_VERONICA><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Thank you. I'm sure Madam Eda would be very
happy.
<PAGE>
The General Store sells fodder, so please be sure
to buy some to feed her.
<PAGE>
When you wish to let your cows outside, simply
get behind them and give them a firm push out
the door.
<PAGE>
I have placed a book about cattle raising on your
bookshelf. Please read it if you have any
questions.
<PAGE>
Now then, I'll take Hanako to your barn.

I got Hanako the cow from Veronica! I should
take good care of her, in memory of Eda.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
This here's a book on your barn. Give it a read if
you're curious.

<FACE_CHLOE><POS_LEFT><FACE_LAUGH>
Oh, hello <MYNAME>! Are you ready for an
extreme home makeover?
I got a <BLUE>Craft Table Blueprint</BLUE>!
I got a <BLUE>Decent House Blueprint</BLUE>!
<BLUE>Using a Blueprint</BLUE> was added to my bookshelf.
<BLUE>Editing</BLUE> was added to my bookshelf.
<BLUE>Barns</BLUE> was added to my bookshelf.
<BLUE>Cow Care</BLUE> was added to my shelf.
<BLUE>Using the Closet</BLUE> was added to my bookshelf.

<FACE_KAISER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well? She's a real beaut', ain't she?
<PAGE>
Now you can start keepin' animals. A farm
without any animals is kinda sad, like havin' only
half a farm.
